translation:
Most Illustrious Sir Rodrigo Antônio da Silva, captain on duty.

By order I received from Sir Vicente Paulo de Oliveira Vilas Boas, I command Your Lordship Sir

Today the horses of Sir Pelúcio and all those who have gathered to be able to follow the column that, for lack of horses, has not advanced to this point, will depart; Your Lordship

In your rear, Your Lordship should have Ensign José Antônio with the good horses that he has sent you.

I warn Your Lordship

The delay of the column is due to the arrival of these horses which, departing today, as soon as they arrive, the column will set out to this point; this will also be made known to Sir Your Lordship

Note Well Your Lordship His Excellency

God keep Your Lordship Passo do Mampituba, February 7, 1839. Paulo Pereira da Silva Alano, Sergeant-Major in charge.
